job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Los Angeles, CA
pros: SCC is the best non-profit I've ever worked for. Caseload is manageable and small bonus is paid out if you exceed billable hours. The behavioral health team really felt like a team, supervisor is available and open to suggestions. I think the company offers excellent benefits and even pays for your health plan deductible. I felt support by case managers and medical team is responsive when we have a mutual patient.
cons: While I think salary is extremely fair given billing requirements, not reflective of competitive market or cost of living near clinic sites.

job_title: Systems Analyst!! in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Almost nothing except health benefits which eventually every company will offer that to their employees!!
No perks what so ever. Oh, wait you can get hot filtered drinking water in the kitchen!!!
cons:
Incompetent Managers in IT and HR they hire you and let you go after a month stating you are not fit for the position without any performance evaluation 'INK ON PAPER".
Lack of communication between management and between employees.
unpleasant environment to work in, as a new employee did not got a proper training on their system and they expect you to know it.

review_title: Overall great experience and feeling of giving back to the community.
pros: The Saban Free Clinic offers an excellent benefits package better than most Fortune 500 companies in terms of health benefits. In addition, there are many opportunities to take a leadership role in various projects and/or improve work processes.
cons: Overall great work enviornment, but staff can be petty at times. Gossip does run rampant and it's best to stay out of the mix. It is a nonprofit and therefore salaries are not the best compared to working in Corporate America.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: You get to meet patients from around the world.
cons: Management is horrible. Their creed is patient first, well that’s a lie. Working there is being in HS all over again. The more you complain about your coworkers the more attention and respect you get from management.
